shortIntro.title: What Your Device Needs for Smooth Stumble Guys Gameplay
shortIntro.para1: Stumble Guys is a fast-paced multiplayer knockout game where smooth movement, quick reactions, and stable frame pacing matter the most. Since up to 32 players compete in a single lobby, even small frame drops, lag spikes, or delayed jumps can affect your match outcome.
shortIntro.para2: The game looks simple, but its physics-based animations, fast transitions between maps, and online connectivity require a stable device to avoid stutters, input delay, and random freezes.

intro: Below are the updated minimum and recommended specifications required to run Stumble Guys smoothly on Android and iOS. These values are based on official data, esports-level gameplay testing, and real in-match performance on multiple devices.

recommended.Internet: Low-ping 5G or high-quality Wi-Fi to avoid teleport lag

ios_intro: Stumble Guys is very well optimized on iOS thanks to stable frame pacing, consistent touch response, and Apple's strong CPU/GPU integration.
fps_intro: Stumble Guys performance heavily depends on smooth animations and stable frame pacing, especially during crowded rounds like Block Dash or Laser Tracer.

fps_list.fps: 60–120 FPS feel on 90Hz–144Hz screens, excellent input response

settings_intro: These settings help achieve smoother gameplay, faster movement control, and reduced lag in Stumble Guys.

low_end.title: Graphics
low_end.value: Set to LOW for smoother movement

low_end.title: Background Apps
low_end.value: Close all to avoid jump delay

high_end.title: Game Booster
high_end.value: Turn ON to reduce frame timing issues

high_end.title: RAM Optimization
high_end.value: Keep 1GB+ RAM free for instant level loading

sectionIntro: Below are the most popular Android and iOS devices known for smooth and competitive Stumble Guys performance.
androidDevices: Poco X3 / X4 / X6 / F3 / F5
storageIntroText: Here is the full breakdown of Stumble Guys’ storage usage including maps, skins, effects, and character assets.
faqIntroText: These are the most frequently asked questions about Stumble Guys device performance and gameplay optimization.

faqList.question: Does Stumble Guys need a powerful device?
faqList.answer: Not really, but a better CPU/GPU keeps movement smooth during crowded rounds and helps prevent input delay.

faqList.question: Can Stumble Guys run at 120 FPS?
faqList.answer: The game isn't fully unlocked, but high refresh rate screens make movement and turning animations feel smoother.

faqList.question: Why do some players lag in multiplayer?
faqList.answer: unstable networks cause teleporting, delayed jumps, and late round starts, affecting competitive rounds.

title: Device Comparison Insights
description: Compare movement smoothness, input delay, stability, and animation performance of top devices for Stumble Guys.

rows.performance: Both perform strongly with stable FPS and fast movement control.
rows.notes: Poco F5 offers snappier responses due to its modern Snapdragon chipset, while GT Neo 3 stays cooler in long tournaments.

rows.performance: Both handle matches well with consistent character movement.
rows.notes: A52 provides smoother frame pacing, while Note 12 Pro loads maps faster and shows better overall CPU stability.

rows.performance: Both give excellent Stumble Guys performance with quick jump and dive responses.
rows.notes: iPhone 12 feels faster due to its A14 chip, while XR is still reliable but slightly slower during asset-heavy maps.
